item.title: Project Description

item.text: The decentralised academy is a project to take the idea of a physical institution for education - a university or college - and to use technology to recreate it embedded into the streets and caf√©s and homes of people around the world.

The decentralised academy is a project to take the idea of a physical institution for education - a university or college - and to use technology to recreate it embedded into the streets and caf√©s and homes of people around the world.
The decentralised academy is a p2p learning project that is layered on top of a decentralised, distributed and federated technical and legal architecture.
The projects aims are to address real issues and needs of communities, through the use of embed learning experiences, using p2p technology, in a range of local community activities.
The projects aims are to use p2p technology to address real issues, by providing embedded learning experiences in the context of local community activities.
Every activity, business or project needs a learning model, and introducing new technology inevitably involves the need to learn new things.

The strategy is to provide a mechanism, that can support and sustain a technical platform, through the provision of education and local community support, that is properly incentivised with new p2p technology.

A central problem the project will address is the sustainability of a socially motivated initiative. Systemically such projects repeatedly fail, based on the burn out of the charismatic central instigators, and the cyclic nature of funding. Projects flourish for a few years and then die before any learning is able to be passed on.
In the particular case of education, experienced teachers in technology, and especially new innovations of any kind are an extremely rare resource.
